oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quilt belonged to Nora Watson Harrill
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The owner of the quilt was the third owner of the quilt. It had been passed down to Nora Watson Harrill by her grandmother Sarah Elizabeth Maxwell who made the quilt. All three ladies lived in Monroe County. Crown of thorns pattern. The husband of the maker served in the Civil War (William Thomas Raper). Initially serving in Co. E, 59th Tenn. Mtd. Inf. Regt., CSA, he later served as a sergeant in Co. A, 7th Tenn. Mtd. Inf., USA. He enlisted in Sept. 1864 in Athens, Tennessee.
